author: TylerLeonhardt
body:
`Get-Process > foo.txt` in a remote session - foo.txt only contains 3 blank lines.

Note: in a normal, non-remote, session this command works as expected and `foo.ps1` contains the output of `Get-Process`.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Enter-PSSession -HostName $ip -UserName $un
Get-Process > foo.txt
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
`foo.txt` should contain the output of `Get-Process`

Actual behavior
---------------
`foo.txt` contains 3 blank lines

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
Host:
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1
OS                             Darwin 16.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.7.0: Thu Jan 11 22:59:40 PST 2018; root:xnu-3789.73.8~1/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Server:
```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1
OS                             Linux 4.13.0-1005-azure #7-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jan 8 21:37:36 UTC 2018
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

I can provide the ubuntu vm if needed.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @PaulHigin @daxian-dbw Looks like general issue with redirection. Thoughts?

title: `Get-Process > foo.txt` in a remote session - foo.txt only contains 3 blank lines
